column4: Hello, is it possible to create a new partition after ubuntu is already installed?
through gparted yes, but i'm fairly certain you can't do it while you're using any of the partitions you'd modify, and even if you could, it's a bad idea, use the GParted liveCD

putting windows on your computer AFTER ubuntu is a recipie for a pain in the ass because windows overwrites GRUB, you'd have to restore it via a liveCD in order to continue using both windows and Ubuntu
i've done it before, but needless to say, it sucked

pretty much, if you installed windows first and left room for an ubuntu partition, you should be able to just install ubuntu and it will detect the existing windows partition and let you choose between the two at boot time
i'm having a hard time putting windows on.  Grub won't run the install disk.  (Well, that is what I can gather from googling it all night.)
well you should be running the install disk BEFORE it gets to GRUB
I enter bios and hit "Run from disk drive" and grub starts up
every bios is different, but at least for me, when i boot up i can hit f2 and choose to boot from the cd drive
you sure you're selecting the correct drive? (like maybe by disk drive it means your hard drive rather than your CD or DVD drive?)
could be.  I'll give it another try.  But grub isn't the defualt now for any OS?
after you install windows you'll lose grub and you'll have to reinstall it via the liveCD (or just reinstall ubuntu but i figure you won't want to do that)
i'd definitely google reinstalling grub beforehand, it's not terribly easy (it's not hard once you know how, but the first time is pretty hard)
what I want to do is leave my computer like it is with the brand new Gutsy, but LabView (National instruments software) only works in windows, osx and rpm based linux, so....
what were you trying to say with that link?
i just thought that was the site for the software, and maybe it would have information that would help kylequamme
